desc: Coveteur, one of the world's fastest growing fashion and lifestyle media brands, is looking for a talented freelance/independent videographer for high-volume video production for our online channels (web, Facebook, Instagram, and YouTube. The videographer will concept, shoot, and work with a video editor when necessary. You will be required to work with a makeup artist, 2 models, and bring a smart, fun approach and distinctly "Coveteur" style -- everything from a quick Facebook Live, to a beauty how-to, to an interview with a fashion icon, models, or celebrity.Responsibilities and Job Details1.	You will shoot videos of makeup artists working on 2 models2.	Concept, pitch, shoot high volume of short-form videos for our channels3.	Work independently4.	Focus on storytelling, bringing our followers along with us as we explore behind the scenes of fashion, beauty, health, wellness and entertainment5.	Responsible for producing video that will resonate with our audience, and drive a high level of engagement and sharing6.	Coordinate with freelance video editor(s) as needed7.	Total budget for the gig is $12000 (videographer gets $5000 while the artists get $7000)8.	You will be required to work with a talent broker that will provide the artists and makeup artist.Deliverables1.	You will deliver 2 short videos2.	Original video will be10 mins long, shortened to 5 mins after editing3.	Transfer method: Fileshare or Dropbox4.	Images delivery deadline: December 29thRequirements1.	Experience shooting video of all types, including social media2.	A natural born storyteller with a nonstop flow of creative ideas to engage video viewers3.	Knowledge and love of luxury fashion, beauty, health and wellness and entertainment4.	Expertise with a variety of cameras, mics, lighting, sound and other necessary equipment5.	Working knowledge of editing software6.	Deep understanding of the video ecosystem, distribution, competition and trendsKnown for delivering stunning original content and an intimate look at luxury lifestyles and global tastemakers, Coveteur was established in 2011 as a passion project to explore the homes and closets of global street style stars and influencers. Since then, Coveteur has evolved and expanded into a global media brand, offering a behind-the-scenes look at all things fashion, beauty and culture.If you think you’re the right candidate for this gig, apply
title: I would like to hire a Videographer

desc: We are looking to commission (or purchase) a large quantity of stock footage.  These must be rights cleared and warrantied that you are the owner of the footage and are providing us with unlimited use (with the proper clearances from any actors featured in the clips).  Royalty-free footage that you do not own is _not_ acceptable.The second requirement is that we need sequences as opposed to one-off shots.  For example, if you have a business scene we need multiple shots with different camera angles, zoom, and position.  Wide angle to set the scene, mid range shots, close-ups, over the shoulder, 1st person, etc.  A sequence needs to have a minimum of 5 of these different types.Themes we're looking for are business related: meetings, greetings, working together, etc.  Examples provided on request.  As a reference, go to [url removed, login to view] and search for "business".Please provide bids per sequence (based on 5 shots for each).  This initial project is small to "test the waters" but has to potential to be much larger and on-going.
title: Film/Supply Stock Footage

desc: Design a teenage character using animation style design. The character should represent a normal teenager wearing a high school uniform with a backpack. Aged between 15-17 years old in a high school setting.The designer should be able to also design a older version of the same character on the work setting. The older version should be between 45-50. He is unhappy with life and the choices is made in his career and in life in general.The younger version of this character gets an opportunity to go back to school with the knowledge of an adult (the future older version) and makes different choices in school. He does this to ensure that he does not repeat the mistakes he previously made in life and school in particular to ensure he has a bright future and satisfying career.The younger version also uses this knowledge to advise and assist other kids in school with career advice and advice about life in general.A animation video has to be designed, using the characters, which explains our concept (30-45 minutes).
title: Character design and 30-45 second animation video explaining our concept
